oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Oklahoma Roundup - 1947-06-05 - KOMA
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance from the Oklahoma Roundup radio program on June 5, 1947 on radio station KOMA (Oklahoma City, Okla). Staff includes Lem Turner (master of ceremonies), Allan Page (announcer, director), and Kenyon Brown (producer).
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chuck Davis; Lexie Lou and Ray; Lem Turner; Ann Bond; Jack Beasley;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (0:00) [Blank] / (1:30) Opening statements which leads into Lem Turner introducing the first song / (1:55) Chuck Davis performs "Ring, Ring The Banjo" / (2:56) Lem Turner and Allan Page tell a joke / (3:27) Lexie Lou performs "I Want To Be A Cowboy Dream Girl" / (5:18) Allan Page and Lem Turner introduce the next song / (5:43) Lem Turner performs "The Little Shirt That Mother Made For Me" / (7:19) Lem Turner introduces Ann Bond / (7:27) Ann Bond performs "Don’t Look Now" / (9:39) Lem Turner and Allan Page tell a joke / (10:12) Ray performs "The Strawberry Roan" / (12:03) Lem Turner tells a joke / (12:18) Jack Beasley performs "You Don’t Care What Happens To Me" / (14:54) Lem Turner introduces Chuck Davis / (15:02) Chuck Davis performs a square dance / (15:45) Closing statements and theme
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Oklahoma Roundup; KOMA (Radio station : Oklahoma City, Okla.); CBS Inc.; Davis, Chuck; Bond, Ann; Beasley, Jack;
